file_content.text: Voss should have a minor groundquake soon. Localized at the statues.
Sergeant. Your path is clear. The statues are real.
I was afraid of that. If the Voss discover these statues... hmm, even a small seismic event might destroy them.
I'll look into it. Your assistance is appreciated.
Are the ruins clear? We must reach the statues before the Republic.
If you're all headed for the shrine, stop a moment. We have trouble that way.
My lord, a moment? Normally I wouldn't presume, but we're in a difficult spot.
You there! Yes, you! I have need of a mercenary, if your prices are reasonable.
Officer. Wherever your post, I'd like to commandeer you for a special mission.
Sergeant Darrst, Imperial Reclamation Service. We've found disturbing evidence of an ancient link between the Jedi and the Voss.
Jedi iconography--statues, to be exact--found in Voss ruins. If authentic, they could make the Voss sympathetic to the Republic.
Surely the Voss can see the Jedi's weakness.
Over some statues?
They have no interest in ideology. Only the Jedi's resemblance to the Mystics.
The Jedi don't have the wit for deception.
We must assume they're real.
And the Republic hasn't the stomach. Still, we shouldn't rule out the possibility.
Bunch of statues? You're kidding, right?
You worry too much.
The Voss have an unseemly interest in the Jedi, despite the Jedi Council's disapproval of their entire way of life.
A Voss alliance would guarantee a Republic victory.
Unacceptable.
Precisely. That's why we have orders to inspect these ruins before the Voss do.
How so?
Simple logic. The argument for an alliance is stronger with proof of an earlier one.
Doesn't affect me.
With the Voss, the Republic could win this war. We can't let them gain more favor.
If we could confirm the statues' authenticity, we could determine how best to handle the situation and the Voss.
Unfortunately, the local natives have overrun the area. Gormak, I think they're called. Ghastly, savage creatures.
Destroy the ruins. Blame the Gormak.
Wipe them out.
The Gormak have no interest in Voss ruins. Suspicion would fall on us.
Get to the point.
You're a coward.
We're scientists, not soldiers. We've lost several scouts to them already.
If you could cut a path through the Gormak, you could examine the statues yourself and report back.
If the statues are fakes, they'll be exposed. If real... we'll do what's necessary to protect the Empire.
I like your outlook.
If you can pay.
I am authorized to offer hazard pay. The amount will be equal to the task.
A few of our scouts managed to send back coordinates of the ruins. You'll find the statues inside.
The Gormak won't make it easy, but examine them as best you can. I'll be waiting. Good luck.
Far too busy. [Refuse quest]
I can only hope someone else volunteers before the statues are discovered.
Please, another time. The data from these ruins must be analyzed.
